ground_meat.name: ground meat
ground_meat.notes: Must be halal-certified. Often contains mixed or non-halal meat

mono_diglycerides.name: mono diglycerides
mono_diglycerides.notes: Source-dependent ingredient. May be animal-derived unless specified plant-based

carmine.name: carmine
carmine.notes: Derived from insects (cochineal). Some schools allow, others don't

shellac.name: shellac
shellac.notes: Derived from insects. Used as shiny coating on candies

animal_shortening.name: animal shortening
animal_shortening.notes: May contain pork fat. Check label for animal fats

glycerin.name: glycerin
glycerin.notes: Animal origin possible. Must be vegetable glycerin

lecithin_animal.name: lecithin animal
lecithin_animal.notes: Animal lecithin uncommon but possible. Soy or sunflower preferred

natural_flavors_meat.name: natural flavors meat
natural_flavors_meat.notes: Can contain meat or alcohol carriers. Check for halal-certified or plant-based

whey_protein.name: whey protein
whey_protein.notes: May be from non-halal dairy. Check for halal-certified

casein.name: casein
casein.notes: Milk protein. Check for halal-certified dairy source

oyster_sauce.name: oyster sauce
oyster_sauce.notes: Some brands contain alcohol. Hanafi school: haram due to shellfish. Others: check for alcohol

canned_soup.name: canned soup
canned_soup.notes: Hidden animal fats common. Check ingredients

beef_broth.name: beef broth
beef_broth.notes: Common in soups and rice. Must be halal-certified

balsamic_vinegar.name: balsamic vinegar
balsamic_vinegar.notes: Traditional balsamic is grape-based only, no alcohol. Check ingredients

stearic_acid.name: stearic acid
stearic_acid.notes: Can be animal or plant-derived. Must be plant-based

palmitic_acid.name: palmitic acid
palmitic_acid.notes: Fatty acid that can be animal or plant-derived

oleic_acid.name: oleic acid
oleic_acid.notes: Usually plant-derived but can be animal-sourced. Check label

beef_jerky.name: beef jerky
beef_jerky.notes: Must be halal-certified. Often contains non-halal meat

artificial_flavoring.name: artificial flavoring
artificial_flavoring.notes: May contain alcohol carriers or meat-based flavors. Check for halal-certified

beeswax.name: beeswax
beeswax.notes: Beeswax is generally considered halal. Used as food coating

msg.name: msg
msg.notes: Generally halal if derived from plant sources or fermentation. Check source

pork.name: pork
pork.notes: Chicken thigh mimics pork fat better than breast

children.name: bacon
children.notes: Add a dash of oil if turkey is lean

children.name: ham
children.notes: Beef pastrami preserves cured flavor

children.name: lard
children.notes: Neutral replacement for frying

children.name: pate
children.notes: Use halal-certified liver only

children.name: pepperoni
children.notes: Typically pork-based. Halal beef preserves spice and chew

children.name: salami
children.notes: Pork is default meat. Must be halal-certified

children.name: hot dogs
children.notes: Often pork or mixed meat. Must be halal-certified

children.name: sausage
children.notes: Choose seasoned chicken sausage to match flavor profile

children.name: gelatin
children.notes: Agar is stronger than gelatin. Check the source before consuming. Must be halal-certified if animal-derived

children.name: marshmallows
children.notes: Marshmallows typically contain gelatin, which may come from pork sources. Must be halal-certified gelatin

children.name: lucky charms
children.notes: Lucky Charms contain marshmallows that typically use pork-derived gelatin

children.name: gummy candy
children.notes: Pork gelatin common. Must be halal-certified gelatin

children.name: jello
children.notes: Typically contains pork gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version

children.name: marshmallow fluff
children.notes: Most contain pork gelatin

children.name: panna cotta
children.notes: Traditionally uses gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version

children.name: cheesecake
children.notes: May contain gelatin in some recipes. Check ingredients or make halal version

children.name: yogurt with gelatin
children.notes: Check ingredients. Some yogurts use gelatin as thickener

children.name: ice cream gelatin
children.notes: May contain gelatin or alcohol

children.name: jelly candies
children.notes: Pork gelatin common. Must be halal-certified

children.name: fruit snacks
children.notes: Often contains gelatin for texture

children.name: mousse
children.notes: Some recipes use gelatin. Check ingredients or make without gelatin

children.name: pate de fruit
children.notes: Traditionally uses pectin or gelatin. Use agar-agar for halal version

children.name: meatballs
children.notes: Frozen products often non-halal. Contains pork or non-halal beef

children.name: ramen seasoning
children.notes: Often contains pork extract or pork-based flavoring

children.name: frozen lasagna
children.notes: Contains pork or non-halal beef. Check ingredients carefully

children.name: refried beans
children.notes: Lard frequently used. Must check label for vegetable oil version

children.name: gravy mix
children.notes: Often contains meat extract or pork flavoring

children.name: potato chips lard
children.notes: Some brands fry in pork fat

children.name: pastries with lard
children.notes: Lard commonly used in bakeries

children.name: meat extract
children.notes: Yeast provides similar depth. Often contains non-halal meat

children.name: pancetta
children.notes: Italian cured pork belly. Use halal beef or turkey version

children.name: prosciutto
children.notes: Italian dry-cured ham. Must use halal-certified alternatives

children.name: pork belly
children.notes: High fat content. Chicken thigh works well

children.name: chorizo
children.notes: Spicy sausage typically pork-based. Use halal beef or chicken version

children.name: instant noodles
children.notes: Seasoning packets often contain pork extract. Check for halal-certified brands

children.name: frozen pizza
children.notes: Often contains pepperoni or pork. Check ingredients carefully

children.name: hot pockets
children.notes: Often contains pepperoni or pork sausage. Check ingredients

children.name: frozen burritos
children.notes: Often contains pork or lard. Check for halal-certified versions

alcohol.name: alcohol
alcohol.notes: Alcohol in any form is prohibited in Islam

children.name: wine
children.notes: Use 3 parts juice + 1 part vinegar

children.name: beer
children.notes: Reduces bitterness without alcohol

children.name: rum
children.notes: Mimics depth without alcohol. Even small amounts are impermissible

children.name: brandy
children.notes: Reduces alcohol while keeping flavor

children.name: whiskey
children.notes: Reduces bitterness and alcohol

children.name: vodka
children.notes: Used only as solvent replacement

children.name: mirin
children.notes: 1 tsp sugar + 1 tsp vinegar

children.name: sake
children.notes: Rice wine contains alcohol

children.name: vanilla extract
children.notes: Ensure alcohol-free labeling. Some scholars allow trace amounts, others don't

children.name: custard
children.notes: Check vanilla source (may contain alcohol)

children.name: creme brulee
children.notes: Check vanilla source (may contain alcohol)

children.name: almond extract
children.notes: Often contains alcohol as carrier. Check for alcohol-free version

children.name: lemon extract
children.notes: May contain alcohol. Use lemon zest or juice instead

children.name: worcestershire sauce
children.notes: Often fermented with alcohol. Check for halal-certified version

children.name: teriyaki sauce
children.notes: Often contains mirin or sake (alcohol). Make homemade halal version

children.name: soy sauce
children.notes: Naturally produces alcohol during fermentation. Most scholars allow if trace amounts

children.name: hoisin sauce
children.notes: Some brands contain alcohol

children.name: bbq sauce
children.notes: Some brands add whiskey or wine

children.name: demi glace
children.notes: Traditionally made with wine

children.name: cake glaze
children.notes: Some glazes use alcohol. Use fruit or sugar glazes instead

children.name: liqueur chocolate
children.notes: Contains intoxicants. Avoid all chocolate with alcohol fillings

children.name: tiramisu
children.notes: Contains coffee liqueur or alcohol. Make halal version without alcohol

children.name: rum cake
children.notes: Alcohol used for moisture/flavor

children.name: chocolate liqueurs
children.notes: Contains alcohol fillings. Avoid all varieties

children.name: mustard wine
children.notes: Some use wine vinegar

children.name: wine vinegar
children.notes: No alcohol involvement in final product. Some scholars allow

children.name: grand marnier
children.notes: Orange-flavored liqueur. Use orange extract instead

children.name: kirsch
children.notes: Cherry-flavored alcohol. Use cherry extract or juice

children.name: amaretto
children.notes: Almond-flavored liqueur. Use almond extract instead

children.name: kahlua
children.notes: Coffee-flavored liqueur. Use strong espresso instead

children.name: ice cream alcohol
children.notes: Some premium ice creams contain alcohol. Avoid all varieties with alcohol

children.name: chocolate truffles
children.notes: May contain liqueur fillings. Check ingredients or make halal version

rennet_cheese.name: rennet cheese
rennet_cheese.notes: Most rennet comes from non-halal calves. Microbial rennet is halal-safe

animal_rennet.name: animal rennet
animal_rennet.notes: Common in cheese production. Check for microbial/vegetarian sources

children.name: parmesan cheese
children.notes: Traditionally uses animal rennet. Look for vegetarian or halal-certified versions

children.name: blue cheese
children.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Check for halal-certified versions

children.name: feta cheese
children.notes: May use animal rennet. Check ingredients or use halal-certified

children.name: brie cheese
children.notes: May use animal rennet. Check for vegetarian or halal-certified

children.name: camembert
children.notes: Soft cheese may use animal rennet. Check label

children.name: gouda
children.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Look for vegetarian or halal versions

children.name: cheddar
children.notes: May use animal rennet. Check for vegetarian or halal versions

children.name: swiss cheese
children.notes: Often uses animal rennet. Check for halal-certified versions

l_cysteine.name: l cysteine
l_cysteine.notes: Often derived from human hair or feathers. Must be plant-based or synthetic

pepsin.name: pepsin
pepsin.notes: Derived from pig stomach lining. Must use plant-based alternatives

lipase.name: lipase
lipase.notes: Often pork-derived unless specified. Used in cheese flavoring
